snippet: After growing 2.3 percent in 2012, the world economy should pick up modestly in the coming years, from 2.4 percent this year to 3.3 percent in 2015.
abstract: World Bank's latest Global Economic Prospects report describes 'dramatic' easing of financial conditions around the world, but still warns that global growth will continue to be sluggish for years to come.
lead_paragraph: After growing 2.3 percent in 2012, the world economy should pick up modestly in the coming years, from 2.4 percent this year to 3.3 percent in 2015.

headline.seo: Global Economy Is Looking Brighter, World Bank Says
headline.main: Global Economy Brightens With Modest Growth Ahead, World Bank Says
